abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome was unsatisfactory,
            sustainability unlikely, and the institutional development
            impact negligible. Initial supervision missions were
            understaffed, and inattentive to difficulties, which despite
            improvements in the later phases of supervision, resulted in
            an unsatisfactory Bank performance. Similarly, failure to
            establish appropriate management systems, and the weak
            results of physical components, assesses an unsatisfactory
            Borrower performance. Lessons show the delicate balance of
            implementing agencies in handling large amounts, and
            different types of work, under weak capacity situations, and
            lack of experience. The Agence Tchadienne d'Execution
            de Travaux d'Interet Public (ATETIP) committed itself
            to an extraordinary amount of projects, and the new Agence
            d'Execution de Travaux d'Interet Public (AGETIP),
            proved inexperienced, particularly with the introduction of
            private contracting practices into prevailing government
            administration experience. This clearly demands intensive
            technical assistance, to build capacity, which should
            include a careful assessment of staff with private sector
            experience. Also, the specialized nature of delegated
            contract management, require adequate supervision to conduct
            financial, and technical reviews, able to identify, and
            remedy problematic subprojects, prior to implementation.
